alert.note: Alert for McLean (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 16 at 3:33AM CST until February 17 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...WINTER STORM TO BRING A WINTRY MIXTURE OF PRECIPITATION AND HEAVY SNOW TO PARTS OF CENTRAL IL LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation followed by heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 7 inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...McLean County. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A change from rain to mixed precipitation will occur late Wednesday night, becoming all snow by late morning Thursday. The heaviest snow accumulation will be from late morning through the afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com
